body: This is not new groupchats. This is just upgrade to old groupchats with some advatages: - Groupchats are now saved into tox_save - Client can get groupchat unique id to save message log - Auto restore groupchats after restart even your friend uses non-upgraded version Depends on #795. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/769)

comment_regular_data.body: This is the review of #295. I'm going to make fixes here and eventually push it to #295 so that it can be merged from there.
@iphydf It's bad idea add extra commits to this PR (I'm talking about crypto_memcmp test)

@Diadlo ignore that commit. Only review the one commit at the end. I have based it on the memcmp one because that PR fixes spurious test failures that are just annoying, not useful. The way to fix this problem is by reviewing #757.

Reviewed 7 of 8 files at r1, 2 of 13 files at r2, 12 of 13 files at r4, 1 of 1 files at r5.
Review status: 19 of 20 files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions.

---

*[auto_tests/conference_test.c, line 62 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/769#-L4geD7cg3vlbf6AmdzT:-L4geD7cg3vlbf6AmdzU:b-2rrqx) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/844d83a96e7e5e041c400e03fc54b8d2827af51a/auto_tests/conference_test.c#L62)):*
> ```C
>     // TODO(robinlinden): Fix tox_conference_join to disallow joining a
>     // conference we are already in.
> #if 0
> ```

I'm ok with with it if it will be declared behaviour. So remove `TODO` and test case?

---

*[toxcore/group.h, line 101 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/769#-L4hGNEM-v00hBqCpwPK:-L4hGNEM-v00hBqCpwPL:bsma0fy) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/e02df48fdf425350fa9e67dea48e998a31432da2/toxcore/group.h#L101)):*
> ```objc
> 
>     void (*peer_on_join)(void *, int, int);
>     void (*peer_on_leave)(void *, int32_t, void *);
> ```

Why the second parameter is `int32_t` while in other pointers `int`?

---

*[toxcore/group.c, line 365 at r7](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/769#-L5B78H7QkpxnqKoAOHl:-L5B78H7QkpxnqKoAOHm:b-mu4k0z) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/cf26a25a9b70fd18c581ee40393ad23fdd898e24/toxcore/group.c#L365)):*

>         uint16_t rmpeer = g->closest_peers[index];
>         g->closest_peers[index] = peerindex;
>         g->closest_peers_entry |= 1 << index;

with this line we need to ensure `DESIRED_CLOSE_CONNECTIONS < 31`, maybe add `#error` guard? Also it's better to shift an uint, because there are no problems with the sign bit

---

*[toxcore/group.h, line 62 at r7](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/769#-L5B8hd4-h5Uf-G0enPm:-L5B8hd4-h5Uf-G0enPn:bnjt4rc) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/cf26a25a9b70fd18c581ee40393ad23fdd898e24/toxcore/group.h#L62)):*

>     unsigned    nick_len : 8;
>     unsigned    group_number : 16;
>     unsigned    keep_connection : 8; /* keep connection even not in ring (count down every incoming ping packet) */
> ```

same as below

---

*[toxcore/group.h, line 116 at r7](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/769#-L5B7xIOnq4lIIoNdnBW:-L5B7xIOnq4lIIoNdnBX:b4fznn5) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/cf26a25a9b70fd18c581ee40393ad23fdd898e24/toxcore/group.h#L116)):*

>

I understand the 1 bit bitfields, but I don't think it makes sense to put `title_len keep_join_index and lossy_message_number` into the bitfield, or is this again transfered over the wire?

I understand the 1 bit bitfields, but I don't think it makes sense to put `title_len keep_join_index and lossy_message_number` into the bitfield, or is this again transfered over the wire?
No, but it's 24 bits. I've changed the 8 and 16 bit ones to the appropriate types, but this one is a signed 24 bit int, and I don't know the effects of changing that. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/769)*

commit.message:
Make conferences persistent across restarts and reconnects.

This is not new groupchats. This is just upgrade to old groupchats with
some advantages:
- Groupchats are now saved into tox_save.
- Clients can get groupchat unique id to save message log.
- Auto restore groupchats after restart even your friend uses
  non-upgraded version.

verification.payload:
tree 1f52a6bb765cb1e9c8326215eed8efbbd9cb2748
parent b2a2a0bbc7c3aac655bc9efc1c8f385adfe90a3f
author isotoxin <isotoxin.dev@yandex.ru> 1478865374 +0300
committer iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1519406537 +0000

Make conferences persistent across restarts and reconnects.

This is not new groupchats. This is just upgrade to old groupchats with
some advantages:
- Groupchats are now saved into tox_save.
- Clients can get groupchat unique id to save message log.
- Auto restore groupchats after restart even your friend uses
  non-upgraded version.

labels.description: New feature for the user, not a new feature for build script
labels.name: enhancement

labels.description: Refactoring production code, eg. renaming a variable, not affecting semantics
labels.name: refactor

title: Make conferences persistent across restarts and reconnects.
